meanings.definition: Resembling a lemon in color or taste.
meanings.sent1: The lemonish walls of the kitchen brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: She added a lemonish twist to the salad with a squeeze of citrus.
meanings.sent3: The lemonish cupcakes looked so realistic, they could be mistaken for fruit!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as lemonish as the sun on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The lemonish aroma of the cleaning spray filled the air.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or characteristics similar to those of a lemon.
meanings.sent1: The lemonish cat had a sour expression on its face.
meanings.sent2: His lemonish personality always brought a tangy energy to the group.
meanings.sent3: The lemonish car zipped down the road, leaving a citrusy trail behind.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a lemonish effect, leaving a bitter taste in his mouth.
meanings.sent5: The lemonish dress she wore made her stand out in the crowd.
